annotation.infon: positive regulation of DNA biosynthetic process|GO:2000573
annotation.text: Depletion of beta-arrestin2 shows significant reduction on both ANG- and SII-mediated thymidine incorporation
Both ANG- and SII-induced EGFR phosphorylation at Tyr-845 is dramatically reduced by depletion of beta-arrestin2 expression by siRNA.

Depletion of beta-arrestin2 shows a significant reduction on both ANG and SII mediated phosphorylation of EGFR at Tyr-845 compared with its own agonist stimulation in the control siRNA-transfected condition (**, p < 0.05).
